ConditionOperator.description:
Comparator describes the type of comparison.

 - OPERATOR_UNSPECIFIED: The default value
 - OPERATOR_EQUALS: Verify if the property values are strictly equal or not.
 - OPERATOR_GREATER_THAN: Verify if the oracle data value is greater than the Condition value.
 - OPERATOR_GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL: Verify if the oracle data value is greater than or equal to the Condition
value.
 - OPERATOR_LESS_THAN: Verify if the oracle data value is less than the Condition value.
 - OPERATOR_LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL: Verify if the oracle data value is less or equal to than the Condition
value.

MarketTradingMode.description:
- TRADING_MODE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, this is invalid
 - TRADING_MODE_CONTINUOUS: Normal trading
 - TRADING_MODE_BATCH_AUCTION: Auction trading (FBA)
 - TRADING_MODE_OPENING_AUCTION: Opening auction
 - TRADING_MODE_MONITORING_AUCTION: Auction triggered by monitoring
MarketTradingMode.title: The trading mode the market is currently running, also referred to as 'market state'

OrderTimeInForce.description:
- TIME_IN_FORCE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value for TimeInForce, can be valid for an amend
 - TIME_IN_FORCE_GTC: Good until cancelled
 - TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT: Good until specified time
 - TIME_IN_FORCE_IOC: Immediate or cancel
 - TIME_IN_FORCE_FOK: Fill or kill
 - TIME_IN_FORCE_GFA: Good for auction
 - TIME_IN_FORCE_GFN: Good for normal
OrderTimeInForce.title:
Time In Force for an order
See [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.testnet.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail

VoteValue.description:
- VALUE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - VALUE_NO: A vote against the proposal
 - VALUE_YES: A vote in favour of the proposal
VoteValue.title: Vote value

end.title: Timestamp containing the end time for an auction

extension_trigger.title:
If an auction was ongoing, but was extended for whatever reason, this field will
be set to the trigger type indicating which component extended the auction

leave.title: True if the event indicates leaving auction mode and False otherwise

opening_auction.title: True if the event indicates an auction opening and False otherwise

start.title: Timestamp containing the start time for an auction

trigger.title: the reason this market is/was in auction

v1AuctionEvent.title: An auction event indicating a change in auction state, for example starting or ending an auction

block.title: The batch (or block) of transactions that the events relate to

id.title: A unique event identifier for the message

tx_err_event.title: Transaction error events, not included in the ALL event type

type.title: The type of bus event (one of the list below)

v1BusEvent.title: A bus event is a container for event bus events emitted by Vega

v1BusEventType.description:
- BUS_EVENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ALL: Events of ALL event types, used when filtering stream from event bus
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_TIME_UPDATE: Event for blockchain time updates
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_TRANSFER_RESPONSES: Event for when a transfer happens internally, contains the transfer information
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_POSITION_RESOLUTION: Event indicating position resolution has occurred
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ORDER: Event for order updates, both new and existing orders
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ACCOUNT: Event for account updates
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_PARTY: Event for party updates
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_TRADE: Event indicating a new trade has occurred
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_MARGIN_LEVELS: Event indicating margin levels have changed for a party
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_PROPOSAL: Event for proposal updates (for governance)
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_VOTE: Event indicating a new vote has occurred (for governance)
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_MARKET_DATA: Event for market data updates
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_NODE_SIGNATURE: Event for a new signature for a Vega node
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_LOSS_SOCIALIZATION: Event indicating loss socialisation occurred for a party
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_SETTLE_POSITION: Event for when a position is being settled
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_SETTLE_DISTRESSED: Event for when a position is distressed
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_MARKET_CREATED: Event indicating a new market was created
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ASSET: Event for when an asset is added to Vega
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_MARKET_TICK: Event indicating a market tick event
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_WITHDRAWAL: Event for when a withdrawal occurs
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_DEPOSIT: Event for when a deposit occurs
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_AUCTION: Event indicating a change in auction state, for example starting or ending an auction
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_RISK_FACTOR: Event indicating a risk factor has been updated
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_NETWORK_PARAMETER: Event indicating a network parameter has been added or updated
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_LIQUIDITY_PROVISION: Event indicating a liquidity provision has been created or updated
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_MARKET_UPDATED: Event indicating a new market was created
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ORACLE_SPEC: Event indicating an oracle spec has been created or updated
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ORACLE_DATA: Event indicating that an oracle data has been broadcast
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_DELEGATION_BALANCE: Event indicating that an delegation balance of a party to a node for current epoch has changed
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_VALIDATOR_SCORE: Event indicating the validator score for the given epoch
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_EPOCH_UPDATE: Event indicating the start or end of an epoch
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_VALIDATOR_UPDATE: Event indicating that validator node has been updated
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_STAKE_LINKING: Event indicating a new staking event have been processed by the network
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_REWARD_PAYOUT_EVENT: Event indicating the payout of a reward has been initiated
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_CHECKPOINT: Event indicating a new checkpoint was created
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_MARKET: Event indicating a market related event, for example when a market opens
 - BUS_EVENT_TYPE_TX_ERROR: Event used to report failed transactions back to a user, this is excluded from the ALL type
v1BusEventType.title:
An (event) bus event type is used to specify a type of event
It has 2 styles of event:
Single values (e.g. BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ORDER) where they represent one data item
Group values (e.g. BUS_EVENT_TYPE_AUCTION) where they represent a group of data items

operator.description: comparator is the type of comparison to make on the value.

value.description: value is used by the comparator.

v1Condition.title: Condition describes the condition that must be validated by the

amount.title: The amount of stake to delegate

node_id.title: The ID for the node to delegate to

v1DelegateSubmission.title: A command to submit an instruction to delegate some stake to a node

v1DelegationBalanceEvent.title: DelegationBalanceEvent - updates on the delegation balance of a party to a node in the current epoch in effect

end_time.title: What time did it actually end

expire_time.title: What time should this epoch end

seq.title: Sequence number that increases by one each epoch

start_time.title: What time did this epoch start

v1Filter.description:
Filter describes the conditions under which an oracle data is considered of
interest or not.

conditions.description:
conditions are the conditions that should be matched by the data to be
considered of interest.

key.description: key is the oracle data property key targeted by the filter.

timestamp.title:
Timestamp representation of current VegaTime as represented in
Nanoseconds since the epoch, for example `1580473859111222333` corresponds to `2020-01-31T12:30:59.111222333Z`

v1GetVegaTimeResponse.title: Response for the current consensus coordinated time on the Vega network, referred to as "VegaTime"

v1LastBlockHeightResponse.title:
A response with the height of the last block processed by
tendermint

buys.title: A set of liquidity buy orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

commitment_amount.title: Specified as a unitless number that represents the amount of settlement asset of the market

fee.title: Nominated liquidity fee factor, which is an input to the calculation of taker fees on the market, as per seeting fees and rewarding liquidity providers

market_id.title: Market identifier for the order, required field

reference.title: A reference to be added to every order created out of this liquidityProvisionSubmission

sells.title: A set of liquidity sell orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

v1LiquidityProvisionSubmission.title: A liquidity provision submitted for a given market

party_id.title: Party identifier (public key) for the event

v1LossSocialization.title: A loss socialization event contains details on the amount of wins unable to be distributed

payload.title: Payload is a unique information string

v1MarketEvent.title:
MarketEvent - the common denominator for all market events
interface has a method to return a string for logging

time.title: Timestamp containing latest update from Vega blockchain aka Vega-time

v1MarketTick.title: A market ticket event contains the time value for when a particular market was last processed on Vega

id.title: The identifier of the resource being signed

kind.title: The kind of resource being signed

v1NodeSignature.title: Represents a signature from a validator, to be used by a foreign chain in order to recognise a decision taken by the Vega network

v1NodeSignatureKind.description:
- NODE_SIGNATURE_KIND_UNSPECIFIED: Represents an unspecified or missing value from the input
 - NODE_SIGNATURE_KIND_ASSET_NEW: Represents a signature for a new asset allow-listing
 - NODE_SIGNATURE_KIND_ASSET_WITHDRAWAL: Represents a signature for an asset withdrawal
v1NodeSignatureKind.title: The kind of the signature created by a node, for example, allow-listing a new asset, withdrawal etc

v1ObserveEventBusResponse.title: Response to a subscribed stream of events from the Vega event bus

v1OracleData.description: OracleData describes an oracle data that has been broadcast.

broadcast_at.description:
broadcast_at is the time at which the data was broadcast for the first
time.

data.title: data holds all the properties of the oracle data

matched_spec_ids.description: matched_specs_ids lists all the oracle specs that matched this oracle data.

pub_keys.description:
pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this
oracle. All the public keys in the oracle data should be contained in these
public keys.

v1OracleSpec.description:
An oracle spec describe the oracle data that a product (or a risk model)
wants to get from the oracle engine.
This message contains additional information used by the API.

filters.description:
filters describes which oracle data are considered of interest or not for
the product (or the risk model).

id.description: id is a hash generated from the OracleSpec data.

pub_keys.description:
pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this
oracle. All the public keys in the oracle data should be contained in these
public keys.

status.title: status describes the status of the oracle spec

v1OracleSpecConfiguration.description:
An oracle spec describe the oracle data that a product (or a risk model)
wants to get from the oracle engine.

filters.description:
filters describes which oracle data are considered of interest or not for
the product (or the risk model).

pub_keys.description:
pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this
oracle. All the public keys in the oracle data should be contained in these
public keys.

v1OracleSpecStatus.description:
- STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: The default value.
 - STATUS_ACTIVE: STATUS_ACTIVE describes an active oracle spec.
 - STATUS_DEACTIVATED: STATUS_DEACTIVATED describes an oracle spec that is not listening to data
anymore.
v1OracleSpecStatus.title: Status describe the status of the oracle spec

expires_at.title:
Amend the expiry time for the order, if the Timestamp value is set, otherwise expiry time will remain unchanged
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

market_id.title: Market identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated

order_id.title: Order identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated, required field

pegged_offset.title: Amend the pegged order offset for the order

pegged_reference.title:
Amend the pegged order reference for the order
- See [`PeggedReference`](#vega.PeggedReference)

price.title: Amend the price for the order, if the Price value is set, otherwise price will remain unchanged - See [`Price`](#vega.Price)

size_delta.title:
Amend the size for the order by the delta specified:
- To reduce the size from the current value set a negative integer value
- To increase the size from the current value, set a positive integer value
- To leave the size unchanged set a value of zero

time_in_force.title:
Amend the time in force for the order, set to TIME_IN_FORCE_UNSPECIFIED to remain unchanged
- See [`TimeInForce`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

v1OrderAmendment.title: An order amendment is a request to amend or update an existing order on Vega

market_id.title: Market identifier for the order, required field

order_id.title: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus), required field

v1OrderCancellation.title: An order cancellation is a request to cancel an existing order on Vega

expires_at.title:
Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch,
required field only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT`
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

market_id.title: Market identifier for the order, required field

pegged_order.title:
Used to specify the details for a pegged order
- See [`PeggedOrder`](#vega.PeggedOrder)

price.title:
Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places,
, required field for limit orders, however it is not required for market orders

reference.title:
Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus, currently
set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

side.title: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL, required field - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

size.title: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts, cannot be negative

time_in_force.title:
Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires, required field
- See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)

type.title: Type for the order, required field - See [`Order.Type`](#vega.Order.Type)

v1OrderSubmission.title: An order submission is a request to submit or create a new order on Vega

mark_price.title:
Mark price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

v1PositionResolution.title: A position resolution event contains information on distressed trades

success.title:
Success will be true if the event was accepted by the node,
**Important** - success does not mean that the event is confirmed by consensus

v1PropagateChainEventResponse.title: Response for a new event sent by the blockchain queue to be propagated on Vega

v1Property.description: Property describes one property of an oracle spec with a key with its value.

name.description: name is the name of the property.

value.description: value is the value of the property.

v1PropertyKey.description: PropertyKey describes the property key contained in an oracle data.

name.description: name is the name of the property.

type.description: type is the type of the property.

v1PropertyKeyType.description:
Type describes the type of properties that are supported by the oracle
engine.

 - TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: The default value.
 - TYPE_EMPTY: Any type.
 - TYPE_INTEGER: Integer type.
 - TYPE_STRING: String type.
 - TYPE_BOOLEAN: Boolean type.
 - TYPE_DECIMAL: Any floating point decimal type.
 - TYPE_TIMESTAMP: Timestamp date type.

terms.title: Proposal configuration and the actual change that is meant to be executed when proposal is enacted

v1ProposalSubmission.title:
A command to submit a new proposal for the
vega network governance

v1RestoreSnapshot.title: A command that loads the state from a given checkpoint

margin.title:
Margin value as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

party_id.title: Party identifier (public key) for the event

price.title:
Price as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

v1SettleDistressed.title: A settle distressed event contains information on distressed trading parties who are closed out

party_id.title: Party identifier (public key) for the event

price.title:
Price of settlement as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

trade_settlements.title: A collection of 1 or more trade settlements

v1SettlePosition.title: A settle position event contains position settlement information for a party

v1Signature.description:
A signature to be authenticate a transaction and to be verified by the vega
network.

algo.description: The algorithm used to create the signature.

version.description: The version of the signature used to create the signature.

amount.title: The amount of stake deposited or removed

finalized_at.title: The time at which the vega network finalized the state of the event

id.title: The internal ID for this staking event

party.description: The party to whom the event is directed at.

ts.title: The timestamps at which the event was emitted by ethereum

tx_hash.title: The hash of the transaction from which the events happen

v1StakeLinking.title:
StakeLinking - an event notifying of stake being deposited or removed for a given party
These events are emitted for every Staking deposit or removed accepted by the network

v1StakeLinkingStatus.title:
- STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Default value
 - STATUS_PENDING: Indicate an event waiting for confirmation from the vega network
 - STATUS_ACCEPTED: Indicate of an event accepted by the vega network
 - STATUS_REJECTED: Indaicate of an event rejected by the vega network

v1StakeLinkingType.title:
- TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value
 - TYPE_LINK: Indicate of a stake deposit instruction
 - TYPE_UNLINK: Indicate of a stake remove instruction

account_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to account data

app_version.title: The version of the Vega node software

app_version_hash.title: The version hash of the Vega node software

backlog_length.title: Current backlog length (number of transactions) that are waiting to be included in a block

block_height.title: Current block height as reported by the Vega blockchain

candle_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to candle-stick data

chain_id.title: Unique identifier for the underlying Vega blockchain

chain_version.title: The version of the underlying Vega blockchain

current_time.title: Current system date and time formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision

genesis_time.title: Genesis block date and time formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision

market_data_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to market data

market_depth_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to market depth data

market_depth_updates_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to market depth update data

order_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to order data

positions_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to positions data

status.title:
Status of the connection to the Vega blockchain
- See [`ChainStatus`](#vega.ChainStatus)

total_amend_order.title: Total number of order amendments since genesis (on all markets)

total_cancel_order.title: Total number of order cancellations since genesis (on all markets)

total_create_order.title: Total number of order submissions since genesis (on all markets)

total_markets.title: Total markets on this Vega network

total_orders.title: Total number of orders processed since genesis (on all markets)

total_peers.title: Total number of connected peers to this node

total_trades.title: Total number of trades emitted since genesis (on all markets)

trade_subscriptions.title: Current number of stream subscribers to trade data

uptime.title: Total uptime for this node formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision

vega_time.title: Current Vega date and time formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision

v1Statistics.title: Vega domain specific statistics as reported by the node the caller is connected to

tx.title: A bundle of signed payload and signature, to form a transaction that will be submitted to the Vega blockchain

type.title: Type of transaction request, for example ASYNC, meaning the transaction will be submitted and not block on a response

v1SubmitTransactionV2Request.title: Request for submitting a transaction v2 on Vega

v1SubmitTransactionV2RequestType.description:
- TYPE_ASYNC: The transaction will be submitted without waiting for response
 - TYPE_SYNC: The transaction will be submitted, and blocking until the
tendermint mempool return a response
 - TYPE_COMMIT: The transaction will submitted, and blocking until the tendermint
network will have committed it into a block
v1SubmitTransactionV2RequestType.title: Blockchain transaction type

success.title:
Success will be true if the transaction was accepted by the node,
**Important** - success does not mean that the event is confirmed by consensus

v1SubmitTransactionV2Response.title: Response for submitting a transaction v2 on Vega

timestamp.title: Timestamp containing latest update from Vega blockchain aka Vega-time

v1TimeUpdate.title: A time update event contains the latest time update from Vega blockchain

price.title:
Price of settlement as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

v1TradeSettlement.title: A trade settlement is part of the settle position event

v1Transaction.description: Represents a transaction to be sent to Vega.

address.description: The address of the sender (hex-encoded). Not supported yet.

input_data.description: One of the set of Vega commands (proto marshalled).

pub_key.description: The public key of the sender (hex-encoded).

version.description:
A version of the transaction, to be used in the future in case we want to
implement changes to the Transaction format.

responses.title: One or more entries containing internal transfer information

v1TransferResponses.title: A transfer responses event contains a collection of transfer information

err_msg.title: An error message describing what went wrong

party_id.title: Unique party identifier for the related party

v1ValidatorScoreEvent.title: ValidatorScoreEvent is the score a validator gets for a given epoch

country.title: Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) for the location of the node

ethereum_address.title: Ethereum public key of validator node

info_url.title: URL with more info on the node

vega_pub_key.title: Vega public key of validator node

v1ValidatorUpdate.title: A validator update event contains information about validator node

v1VoteSubmission.description:
A command to submit a new vote for a governance
proposal.

proposal_id.description: The ID of the proposal to vote for.

value.title: The actual value of the vote

asset.title: The asset we want to withdraw

v1WithdrawSubmission.title: Represents the submission request to withdraw funds for a party on Vega

balance.title:
Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
and importantly balances cannot be negative

id.title: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega)

market_id.title: Market identifier for the account, if [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty

owner.title:
The party that the account belongs to, special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is
most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions

type.title: The account type related to this account

vegaAccount.title: Represents an account for an asset on Vega for a particular owner or party

vegaAccountType.description:
- ACCOUNT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_INSURANCE: Insurance pool accounts contain insurance pool funds for a market
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_SETTLEMENT: Settlement accounts exist only during settlement or mark-to-market
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_MARGIN: Margin accounts contain margin funds for a party and each party will
have multiple margin accounts, one for each market they have traded in

Margin account funds will alter as margin requirements on positions change
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL: General accounts contains general funds for a party. A party will
have multiple general accounts, one for each asset they want
to trade with

General accounts are where funds are initially deposited or withdrawn from,
it is also the account where funds are taken to fulfil fees and initial margin requirements
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_INFRASTRUCTURE: Infrastructure accounts contain fees earned by providing infrastructure on Vega
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_LIQUIDITY: Liquidity accounts contain fees earned by providing liquidity on Vega markets
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_MAKER: This account is created to hold fees earned by placing orders that sit on the book
and are then matched with an incoming order to create a trade - These fees reward parties
who provide the best priced liquidity that actually allows trading to take place
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_LOCK_WITHDRAW: This account is created to lock funds to be withdrawn by parties
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_BOND: This account is created to maintain liquidity providers funds commitments
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_EXTERNAL: External account represents an external source (deposit/withdrawal)
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_GLOBAL_INSURANCE: Global insurance account for the asset
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_GLOBAL_REWARD: Global reward account for the asset
vegaAccountType.title: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

details.title: The definition of the external source for this asset

vegaAsset.title: The Vega representation of an external asset

decimals.title: Number of decimal / precision handled by this asset

min_lp_stake.title: Min stake required for this asset from liquidity providers

name.title: Name of the asset (e.g: Great British Pound)

total_supply.title: Total circulating supply for the asset

vegaAssetDetails.title: The Vega representation of an external asset

duration.title: Duration of the auction in seconds

vegaAuctionDuration.title:
An auction duration is used to configure 3 auction periods:
1. `duration > 0`, `volume == 0`:
  The auction will last for at least N seconds
2. `duration == 0`, `volume > 0`:
  The auction will end once we can close with given traded volume
3. `duration > 0`, `volume > 0`:
  The auction will take at least N seconds, but can end sooner if we can trade a certain volume

vegaAuctionTrigger.description:
- AUCTION_TRIGGER_UNSPECIFIED: Default value for AuctionTrigger, no auction triggered
 - AUCTION_TRIGGER_BATCH: Batch auction
 - AUCTION_TRIGGER_OPENING: Opening auction
 - AUCTION_TRIGGER_PRICE: Price monitoring trigger
 - AUCTION_TRIGGER_LIQUIDITY: Liquidity monitoring trigger
vegaAuctionTrigger.title: Auction triggers indicate what condition triggered an auction (if market is in auction mode)

max_faucet_amount_mint.title: Maximum amount that can be requested by a party through the built-in asset faucet at a time

vegaChainStatus.description:
- CHAIN_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - CHAIN_STATUS_DISCONNECTED: Blockchain is disconnected
 - CHAIN_STATUS_REPLAYING: Blockchain is replaying historic transactions
 - CHAIN_STATUS_CONNECTED: Blockchain is connected and receiving transactions
vegaChainStatus.title: The Vega blockchain status as reported by the node the caller is connected to

asset.title: The Vega asset targeted by this deposit

created_timestamp.title: Timestamp for when the deposit was created on the Vega network

credited_timestamp.title: Timestamp for when the Vega account was updated with the deposit

party_id.title: Party identifier of the user initiating the deposit

tx_hash.title: The hash of the transaction from the foreign chain

vegaDeposit.title: A deposit on to the Vega network

vegaDepositStatus.description:
- STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - STATUS_OPEN: The deposit is being processed by the network
 - STATUS_CANCELLED: The deposit has been cancelled by the network
 - STATUS_FINALIZED: The deposit has been finalised and accounts have been updated
vegaDepositStatus.title: The status of the deposit

duration_ns.title: Duration in nanoseconds, maximum 1 month (2592000000000000 ns)

contract_address.title: The address of the contract for the token, on the ethereum network

vegaERC20.title: An ERC20 token based asset, living on the ethereum network

receiver_address.title: The address into which the bridge will release the funds

vegaErc20WithdrawExt.title: An extension of data required for the withdraw submissions

infrastructure_fee.title: Fee amount paid for maintaining the Vega infrastructure

liquidity_fee.title: Fee amount paid to market makers

maker_fee.title: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade

vegaFee.title: Represents any fees paid by a party, resulting from a trade

oracle_spec_binding.title: The binding between the oracle spec and the oracle data

oracle_spec_for_settlement_price.title: The oracle spec describing the settlement price oracle filter

oracle_spec_for_trading_termination.title: the oracle spec describing the trading termination oracle filter

oracle_spec_binding.title: The binding between the oracle spec and the settlement price

oracle_spec_for_settlement_price.title: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of settlement price

oracle_spec_for_trading_termination.title: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of trading termination

tags.title: A list of 0 or more tags

from_account.title: One or more accounts to transfer from

timestamp.title:
Timestamp for the time the ledger entry was created, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

to_account.title: One or more accounts to transfer to

vegaLedgerEntry.title: Represents a ledger entry on Vega

auction_extension.title: Specifies by how many seconds an auction should be extended if leaving the auction were to trigger a liquidity auction

target_stake_parameters.title: Specifies parameters related to target stake calculation

triggering_ratio.title: Specifies the triggering ratio for entering liquidity auction

vegaLiquidityMonitoringParameters.title: LiquidityMonitoringParameters contains settings used for liquidity monitoring

offset.title: The offset/amount of units away for the order

proportion.title: The relative proportion of the commitment to be allocated at a price level

reference.title: The pegged reference point for the order

liquidity_order.title: The liquidity order from the original submission

order_id.title: Unique identifier of the pegged order generated by the core to fulfil this liquidity order

vegaLiquidityOrderReference.title: A pair of a liquidity order and the id of the generated order by the core

average_entry_valuation.title: The average entry valuation of the liquidity provider for the market

equity_like_share.title: The share own by this liquidity provider (float)

vegaLiquidityProviderFeeShare.title: The equity like share of liquidity fee for each liquidity provider

buys.title: A set of liquidity buy orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

commitment_amount.title: Specified as a unitless number that represents the amount of settlement asset of the market

created_at.title:
Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

fee.title: Nominated liquidity fee factor, which is an input to the calculation of taker fees on the market, as per seeting fees and rewarding liquidity providers

market_id.title: Market identifier for the order, required field

party_id.title: Unique party identifier for the creator of the provision

reference.title: A reference shared between this liquidity provision and all it's orders

sells.title: A set of liquidity sell orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

status.title: Status of this liquidity provision order

updated_at.title:
Timestamp for when the order was updated at, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

version.title: Version of this liquidity provision order

vegaLiquidityProvisionStatus.description:
- STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: The default value
 - STATUS_ACTIVE: The liquidity provision is active
 - STATUS_STOPPED: The liquidity provision was stopped by the network
 - STATUS_CANCELLED: The liquidity provision was cancelled by the liquidity provider
 - STATUS_REJECTED: The liquidity provision was invalid and got rejected
 - STATUS_UNDEPLOYED: The liquidity provision is valid and accepted by network, but orders aren't deployed
 - STATUS_PENDING: The liquidity provision is valid and accepted by network
but have never been deployed. I when it's possible to deploy them for the first time
margin check fails, then they will be cancelled without any penalties.
vegaLiquidityProvisionStatus.title: Status of a liquidity provision order

vegaLogNormalModelParams.title: Risk model parameters for log normal

params.title: Risk model parameters for log normal

timestamp.title:
Timestamp for the time the ledger entry was created, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

vegaMarginLevels.title: Represents the margin levels for a party on a market at a given time

decimal_places.title:
Number of decimal places that a price must be shifted by in order to get a
correct price denominated in the currency of the market, for example:
`realPrice = price / 10^decimalPlaces`

market_timestamps.title: Timestamps for when the market stay changes

opening_auction.title:
Auction duration specifies how long the opening auction will run (minimum
duration and optionally a minimum traded volume)

trading_mode.title: Current mode of execution of the market

auction_end.title: Time in seconds until the end of the auction (0 if currently not in auction period)

auction_start.title: Time until next auction (used in FBA's) - currently always 0

best_bid_price.title:
Highest price level on an order book for buy orders, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

best_bid_volume.title: Aggregated volume being bid at the best bid price

best_offer_price.title: Lowest price level on an order book for offer orders

best_offer_volume.title:
Aggregated volume being offered at the best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
 // formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

best_static_bid_price.title: Highest price on the order book for buy orders not including pegged orders

best_static_bid_volume.title: Total volume at the best static bid price excluding pegged orders

best_static_offer_price.title: Lowest price on the order book for sell orders not including pegged orders

best_static_offer_volume.title: Total volume at the best static offer price excluding pegged orders

extension_trigger.title: When a market auction is extended, this field indicates what caused the extension

indicative_price.title: Indicative price (zero if not in auction)

indicative_volume.title: Indicative volume (zero if not in auction)

liquidity_provider_fee_share.title: the equity like share of liquidity fee for each liquidity provider

mark_price.title:
Mark price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

market_trading_mode.title: The current trading mode for the market

mid_price.title:
Arithmetic average of the best bid price and best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

open_interest.title: The sum of the size of all positions greater than 0 on the market

price_monitoring_bounds.title: One or more price monitoring bounds for the current timestamp

static_mid_price.title: Arithmetic average of the best static bid price and best static offer price

supplied_stake.title: Available stake for the given market

target_stake.title: Targeted stake for the given market

timestamp.title:
Timestamp at which this mark price was relevant, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

trigger.title: When a market is in an auction trading mode, this field indicates what triggered the auction

vegaMarketData.title: Represents data generated by a market when open

vegaMarketState.description:
- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, invalid
 - STATE_PROPOSED: The Governance proposal valid and accepted
 - STATE_REJECTED: Outcome of governance votes is to reject the market
 - STATE_PENDING: Governance vote passes/wins
 - STATE_CANCELLED: Market triggers cancellation condition or governance
votes to close before market becomes Active
 - STATE_ACTIVE: Enactment date reached and usual auction exit checks pass
 - STATE_SUSPENDED: Price monitoring or liquidity monitoring trigger
 - STATE_CLOSED: Governance vote (to close)
 - STATE_TRADING_TERMINATED: Defined by the product (i.e. from a product parameter,
specified in market definition, giving close date/time)
 - STATE_SETTLED: Settlement triggered and completed as defined by product
vegaMarketState.title: The current state of the Market

close.title: Time when the market is closed

open.title: Time when the market has left the opening auction and is ready to accept trades

pending.title: Time when the market has been voted in and is created into an opening auction

proposed.title: Time when the market is first proposed

vegaMarketTimestamps.title: Time stamps for important times about creating, enacting etc the market

value.title: The value for the network parameter

vegaNetworkParameter.title: Represents a network parameter on Vega

changes.title: The configuration of the new asset
The configuration of the new market

liquidity_commitment.title: The commitment from the party creating the NewMarket proposal

buys.title: A set of liquidity buy orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

commitment_amount.title: Specified as a unitless number that represents the amount of settlement asset of the market

fee.title: Nominated liquidity fee factor, which is an input to the calculation of taker fees on the market, as per seeting fees and rewarding liquidity providers

reference.title: A reference to be associated to all orders created from this commitment

sells.title: A set of liquidity sell orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

vegaNewMarketCommitment.title: A commitment of liquidity to be made by the party which proposes a market

decimal_places.title: Decimal places used for the new market

log_normal.title: Log normal risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_LOG_NORMAL is selected

metadata.title: Optional new market meta data, tags

simple.title: Simple risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_SIMPLE is selected

vegaNewMarketConfiguration.title: Configuration for a new market on Vega

settlement_price_property.description:
settlement_price_property holds the name of the property in the oracle data
that should be used as settlement price.
If it is set to "prices.BTC.value", then the Future will use the value of
this property as settlement price.

trading_termination_property.title: the name of the property in the oracle data that signals termination of trading

vegaOracleSpecToFutureBinding.title:
OracleSpecToFutureBinding tells on which property oracle data should be
used as settlement price and which to use the trading terminated trigger

batch_id.title:
Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions
to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation)

created_at.title:
Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

expires_at.title:
Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`, valid only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT`

id.title: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus)

liquidity_provision_id.description: Is this order created as part of a liquidity provision, will be empty if not.

pegged_order.description: Pegged order details, used only if the order represents a pegged order.

price.title:
Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

reason.title:
If the Order `status` is `STATUS_REJECTED` then an [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) reason will be specified
- The default for this field is `ORDER_ERROR_NONE` which signifies that there were no errors

reference.title:
Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus
- Currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

remaining.title: Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED

side.title: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

size.title: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts

status.title:
The current status for the order. See [`Order.Status`](#vega.Order.Status)
- For detail on `STATUS_REJECTED` please check the [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) value given in the `reason` field

time_in_force.title:
Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires.
- See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)

updated_at.title:
Timestamp for when the Order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

version.title: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

vegaOrder.title: An order can be submitted, amended and cancelled on Vega in an attempt to make trades with other parties

vegaOrderError.description:
- ORDER_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, no error reported
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_MARKET_ID: Order was submitted for a market that does not exist
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_ORDER_ID: Order was submitted with an invalid identifier
 - ORDER_ERROR_OUT_OF_SEQUENCE: Order was amended with a sequence number that was not previous version + 1
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_REMAINING_SIZE: Order was amended with an invalid remaining size (e.g. remaining greater than total size)
 - ORDER_ERROR_TIME_FAILURE: Node was unable to get Vega (blockchain) time
 - ORDER_ERROR_REMOVAL_FAILURE: Failed to remove an order from the book
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_EXPIRATION_DATETIME: An order with `TimeInForce.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT` was submitted or amended
with an expiration that was badly formatted or otherwise invalid
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_ORDER_REFERENCE: Order was submitted or amended with an invalid reference field
 - ORDER_ERROR_EDIT_NOT_ALLOWED: Order amend was submitted for an order field that cannot not be amended (e.g. order identifier)
 - ORDER_ERROR_AMEND_FAILURE: Amend failure because amend details do not match original order
 - ORDER_ERROR_NOT_FOUND: Order not found in an order book or store
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_PARTY_ID: Order was submitted with an invalid or missing party identifier
 - ORDER_ERROR_MARKET_CLOSED: Order was submitted for a market that has closed
 - ORDER_ERROR_MARGIN_CHECK_FAILED: Order was submitted, but the party did not have enough collateral to cover the order
 - ORDER_ERROR_MISSING_GENERAL_ACCOUNT: Order was submitted, but the party did not have an account for this asset
 - ORDER_ERROR_INTERNAL_ERROR: Unspecified internal error
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_SIZE: Order was submitted with an invalid or missing size (e.g. 0)
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_PERSISTENCE: Order was submitted with an invalid persistence for its type
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_TYPE: Order was submitted with an invalid type field
 - ORDER_ERROR_SELF_TRADING: Order was stopped as it would have traded with another order submitted from the same party
 - ORDER_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS_TO_PAY_FEES: Order was submitted, but the party did not have enough collateral to cover the fees for the order
 - ORDER_ERROR_INCORRECT_MARKET_TYPE: Order was submitted with an incorrect or invalid market type
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_TIME_IN_FORCE: Order was submitted with invalid time in force
 - ORDER_ERROR_GFN_ORDER_DURING_AN_AUCTION: A GFN order has got to the market when it is in auction mode
 - ORDER_ERROR_GFA_ORDER_DURING_CONTINUOUS_TRADING: A GFA order has got to the market when it is in continuous trading mode
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_AMEND_TO_GTT_WITHOUT_EXPIRYAT: Attempt to amend order to GTT without ExpiryAt
 - ORDER_ERROR_EXPIRYAT_BEFORE_CREATEDAT: Attempt to amend ExpiryAt to a value before CreatedAt
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_HAVE_GTC_AND_EXPIRYAT: Attempt to amend to GTC without an ExpiryAt value
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_AMEND_TO_FOK_OR_IOC: Amending to FOK or IOC is invalid
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_AMEND_TO_GFA_OR_GFN: Amending to GFA or GFN is invalid
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_AMEND_FROM_GFA_OR_GFN: Amending from GFA or GFN is invalid
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_SEND_IOC_ORDER_DURING_AUCTION: IOC orders are not allowed during auction
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_SEND_FOK_ORDER_DURING_AUCTION: FOK orders are not allowed during auction
 - ORDER_ERROR_MUST_BE_LIMIT_ORDER: Pegged orders must be LIMIT orders
 - ORDER_ERROR_MUST_BE_GTT_OR_GTC: Pegged orders can only have TIF GTC or GTT
 - ORDER_ERROR_WITHOUT_REFERENCE_PRICE: Pegged order must have a reference price
 - ORDER_ERROR_BUY_CANNOT_REFERENCE_BEST_ASK_PRICE: Buy pegged order cannot reference best ask price
 - ORDER_ERROR_OFFSET_MUST_BE_LESS_OR_EQUAL_TO_ZERO: Pegged order offset must be <= 0
 - ORDER_ERROR_OFFSET_MUST_BE_LESS_THAN_ZERO: Pegged order offset must be < 0
 - ORDER_ERROR_OFFSET_MUST_BE_GREATER_OR_EQUAL_TO_ZERO: Pegged order offset must be >= 0
 - ORDER_ERROR_SELL_CANNOT_REFERENCE_BEST_BID_PRICE: Sell pegged order cannot reference best bid price
 - ORDER_ERROR_OFFSET_MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_ZERO: Pegged order offset must be > zero
 - ORDER_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_ASSET_BALANCE: The party has an insufficient balance, or does not have
a general account to submit the order (no deposits made
for the required asset)
 - ORDER_ERROR_CANNOT_AMEND_PEGGED_ORDER_DETAILS_ON_NON_PEGGED_ORDER: Cannot amend a non pegged orders details
 - ORDER_ERROR_UNABLE_TO_REPRICE_PEGGED_ORDER: We are unable to re-price a pegged order because a market price is unavailable
 - ORDER_ERROR_UNABLE_TO_AMEND_PRICE_ON_PEGGED_ORDER: It is not possible to amend the price of an existing pegged order
 - ORDER_ERROR_NON_PERSISTENT_ORDER_OUT_OF_PRICE_BOUNDS: An FOK, IOC, or GFN order was rejected because it resulted in trades outside the price bounds
vegaOrderError.title:
OrderError codes are returned in the `[Order](#vega.Order).reason` field - If there is an issue
with an order during its life-cycle, it will be marked with `status.ORDER_STATUS_REJECTED`

vegaOrderStatus.description:
Status values for an order
See resulting status in [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.testnet.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail.

 - STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - STATUS_ACTIVE: Used for active unfilled or partially filled orders
 - STATUS_EXPIRED: Used for expired GTT orders
 - STATUS_CANCELLED: Used for orders cancelled by the party that created the order
 - STATUS_STOPPED: Used for unfilled FOK or IOC orders, and for orders that were stopped by the network
 - STATUS_FILLED: Used for closed fully filled orders
 - STATUS_REJECTED: Used for orders when not enough collateral was available to fill the margin requirements
 - STATUS_PARTIALLY_FILLED: Used for closed partially filled IOC orders
 - STATUS_PARKED: Order has been removed from the order book and has been parked, this applies to pegged orders only

vegaOrderType.description:
- TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - TYPE_LIMIT: Used for Limit orders
 - TYPE_MARKET: Used for Market orders
 - TYPE_NETWORK: Used for orders where the initiating party is the network (with distressed parties)
vegaOrderType.title: Type values for an order

id.title: A unique identifier for the party, typically represented by a public key

vegaParty.title: A party represents an entity who wishes to trade on or query a Vega network

reference.title: Which price point are we linked to

vegaPeggedOrder.title:
Pegged orders are limit orders where the price is specified in the form REFERENCE +/- OFFSET
They can be used for any limit order that is valid during continuous trading

vegaPeggedReference.description:
- PEGGED_REFERENCE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value for PeggedReference, no reference given
 - PEGGED_REFERENCE_MID: Mid price reference
 - PEGGED_REFERENCE_BEST_BID: Best bid price reference
 - PEGGED_REFERENCE_BEST_ASK: Best ask price reference
vegaPeggedReference.title:
A pegged reference defines which price point a pegged order is linked to - meaning
the price for a pegged order is calculated from the value of the reference price point

value.title:
Price value, given as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

max_valid_price.title: Maximum price that isn't currently breaching the specified price monitoring trigger

min_valid_price.title: Minimum price that isn't currently breaching the specified price monitoring trigger

reference_price.title: Reference price used to calculate the valid price range

trigger.title: Price monitoring trigger associated with the bounds

vegaPriceMonitoringBounds.title: Represents a list of valid (at the current timestamp) price ranges per associated trigger

vegaPriceMonitoringParameters.title: PriceMonitoringParameters contains a collection of triggers to be used for a given market

parameters.title: Specifies price monitoring parameters to be used for price monitoring purposes

update_frequency.title: Specifies how often (expressed in seconds) the price monitoring bounds should be updated

vegaPriceMonitoringSettings.title: PriceMonitoringSettings contains the settings for price monitoring

auction_extension.title:
Price monitoring auction extension duration in seconds should the price
breach it's theoretical level over the specified horizon at the specified
probability level

horizon.title: Price monitoring projection horizon  in seconds

vegaPriceMonitoringTrigger.title: PriceMonitoringTrigger holds together price projection horizon , probability level p, and auction extension duration

error_details.description: The detailed error associated to the reason.

party_id.title: Party identifier of the author (the party submitting the proposal)

reason.title: A reason for the current state of the proposal, this may be set in case of REJECTED and FAILED statuses

terms.title: Proposal configuration and the actual change that is meant to be executed when proposal is enacted

timestamp.title: Proposal timestamp for date and time (in nanoseconds) when proposal was submitted to the network

vegaProposalError.description:
- PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED: Default value
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_CLOSE_TIME_TOO_SOON: The specified close time is too early base on network parameters
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_CLOSE_TIME_TOO_LATE: The specified close time is too late based on network parameters
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_ENACT_TIME_TOO_SOON: The specified enact time is too early based on network parameters
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_ENACT_TIME_TOO_LATE: The specified enact time is too late based on network parameters
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_TOKENS: The proposer for this proposal as insufficient tokens
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_INSTRUMENT_SECURITY: The instrument quote name and base name were the same
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_PRODUCT: The proposal has no product
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_PRODUCT: The specified product is not supported
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_FUTURE_PRODUCT_TIMESTAMP: Invalid future maturity timestamp (expect RFC3339)
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_PRODUCT_MATURITY_IS_PASSED: The product maturity is past
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_TRADING_MODE: The proposal has no trading mode
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_TRADING_MODE: The proposal has an unsupported trading mode
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NODE_VALIDATION_FAILED: The proposal failed node validation
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_MISSING_BUILTIN_ASSET_FIELD: A field is missing in a builtin asset source
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_MISSING_ERC20_CONTRACT_ADDRESS: The contract address is missing in the ERC20 asset source
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_ASSET: The asset identifier is invalid or does not exist on the Vega network
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INCOMPATIBLE_TIMESTAMPS: Proposal terms timestamps are not compatible (Validation < Closing < Enactment)
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_RISK_PARAMETERS: No risk parameters were specified
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NETWORK_PARAMETER_INVALID_KEY: Invalid key in update network parameter proposal
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NETWORK_PARAMETER_INVALID_VALUE: Invalid valid in update network parameter proposal
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NETWORK_PARAMETER_VALIDATION_FAILED: Validation failed for network parameter proposal
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_OPENING_AUCTION_DURATION_TOO_SMALL: Opening auction duration is less than the network minimum opening auction time
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_OPENING_AUCTION_DURATION_TOO_LARGE: Opening auction duration is more than the network minimum opening auction time
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_MARKET_MISSING_LIQUIDITY_COMMITMENT: Market proposal is missing a liquidity commitment
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_COULD_NOT_INSTANTIATE_MARKET: Market proposal market could not be instantiate in execution
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_FUTURE_PRODUCT: Market proposal market contained invalid product definition
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_MISSING_COMMITMENT_AMOUNT: Market proposal is missing commitment amount
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_FEE_AMOUNT: Market proposal have invalid fee
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_SHAPE: Market proposal have invalid shape
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_RISK_PARAMETER: Market proposal invalid risk parameter
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_MAJORITY_THRESHOLD_NOT_REACHED: Proposal was declined because vote didn't reach the majority thershold required
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_PARTICIPATION_THRESHOLD_NOT_REACHED: Proposal declined because the participation threshold was not reached
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_ASSET_DETAILS: Asset proposal invalid asset details
vegaProposalError.title: A list of possible errors that can cause a proposal to be in state rejected or failed

vegaProposalState.description:
- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - STATE_FAILED: Proposal enactment has failed - even though proposal has passed, its execution could not be performed
 - STATE_OPEN: Proposal is open for voting
 - STATE_PASSED: Proposal has gained enough support to be executed
 - STATE_REJECTED: Proposal wasn't accepted (proposal terms failed validation due to wrong configuration or failing to meet network requirements)
 - STATE_DECLINED: Proposal didn't get enough votes (either failing to gain required participation or majority level)
 - STATE_ENACTED: Proposal enacted
 - STATE_WAITING_FOR_NODE_VOTE: Waiting for node validation of the proposal
vegaProposalState.title:
Proposal state transition:
Open ->
  - Passed -> Enacted.
  - Passed -> Failed.
  - Declined
Rejected
Proposal can enter Failed state from any other state

closing_timestamp.title:
Timestamp (Unix time in seconds) when voting closes for this proposal,
constrained by `minCloseInSeconds` and `maxCloseInSeconds` network parameters

enactment_timestamp.title:
Timestamp (Unix time in seconds) when proposal gets enacted (if passed),
constrained by `minEnactInSeconds` and `maxEnactInSeconds` network parameters

new_asset.title: Proposal change for creating new assets on Vega

new_market.title: Proposal change for creating new market on Vega

update_market.title: Proposal change for modifying an existing market on Vega

update_network_parameter.title: Proposal change for updating Vega network parameters

vegaProposalTerms.title: Terms for a governance proposal on Vega

market.title: Market ID that relates to this risk factor

vegaRiskFactor.title: Risk factors are used to calculate the current risk associated with orders trading on a given market

vegaScalingFactors.title: Scaling Factors (for use in margin calculation)

vegaSide.description:
- SIDE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - SIDE_BUY: Buy order
 - SIDE_SELL: Sell order
vegaSide.title: A side relates to the direction of an order, to Buy, or Sell

factor_long.title: Pre-defined risk factor value for long

factor_short.title: Pre-defined risk factor value for short

max_move_up.title: Pre-defined maximum price move up that the model considers as valid

min_move_down.title: Pre-defined minimum price move down that the model considers as valid

vegaSimpleModelParams.title: Risk model parameters for simple modelling

params.title: Risk model params for simple modelling

scaling_factor.title: Specifies scaling factors used in target stake calculation

time_window.title: Specifies length of time window expressed in seconds for target stake calculation

vegaTargetStakeParameters.title: TargetStakeParameters contains parameters used in target stake calculation

vegaTimestamp.title:
A timestamp in nanoseconds since epoch
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

aggressor.title: Direction of the aggressive party e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

buy_order.title: Identifier of the order from the buy side

buyer.title: Unique party identifier for the buyer

buyer_auction_batch.title: Auction batch number that the buy side order was placed in

buyer_fee.title: Fee amount charged to the buyer party for the trade

id.title: Unique identifier for the trade (generated by Vega)

market_id.title: Market identifier (the market that the trade occurred on)

price.title:
Price for the trade, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

sell_order.title: Identifier of the order from the sell side

seller.title: Unique party identifier for the seller

seller_auction_batch.title: Auction batch number that the sell side order was placed in

seller_fee.title: Fee amount charged to the seller party for the trade

timestamp.title:
Timestamp for when the trade occurred, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

vegaTrade.title: A trade occurs when an aggressive order crosses one or more passive orders on the order book for a market on Vega

vegaTradeType.description:
- TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - TYPE_DEFAULT: Normal trading between two parties
 - TYPE_NETWORK_CLOSE_OUT_GOOD: Trading initiated by the network with another party on the book,
which helps to zero-out the positions of one or more distressed parties
 - TYPE_NETWORK_CLOSE_OUT_BAD: Trading initiated by the network with another party off the book,
with a distressed party in order to zero-out the position of the party
vegaTradeType.title: Type values for a trade

account.title: The account relating to the transfer

balance.title: The balance relating to the transfer

vegaTransferBalance.title: Represents the balance for an account during a transfer

transfers.title: One or more ledger entries representing the transfers

vegaTransferResponse.title: Represents the response from a transfer

vegaUpdateMarket.title: Update an existing market on Vega

proposal_id.title: Identifier of the proposal being voted on

timestamp.title: Vote timestamp for date and time (in nanoseconds) when vote was submitted to the network

total_governance_token_balance.title: Total number of governance token for the party that casted the vote

total_governance_token_weight.title: The weight of this vote based on the total of governance token

asset.title: The asset we want to withdraw funds from

created_timestamp.title: Timestamp for when the network started to process this withdrawal

expiry.title: The time until when the withdrawal is valid

party_id.title: Unique party identifier of the user initiating the withdrawal

ref.title:
The reference which is used by the foreign chain
to refer to this withdrawal

tx_hash.title: The hash of the foreign chain for this transaction

withdrawn_timestamp.title: Timestamp for when the withdrawal was finalised by the network

vegaWithdrawal.title: A withdrawal from the Vega network

vegaWithdrawalStatus.description:
- STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid
 - STATUS_OPEN: The withdrawal is open and being processed by the network
 - STATUS_CANCELLED: The withdrawal have been cancelled
 - STATUS_FINALIZED: The withdrawal went through and is fully finalised, the funds are removed from the
Vega network and are unlocked on the foreign chain bridge, for example, on the Ethereum network
vegaWithdrawalStatus.title: The status of the withdrawal

get.summary: Get the height of the last tendermint block
